# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df := hcat(df, [map((x)-> string(year(x)) * string(month(x)), df.dt)]; rename=:ym)
end
```

This function uses the `Dates` module for extracting year and month from DateTimes. It creates a new column named "ym" by applying the map function to every element in the 'dt' column and concatenating year and month using string concatenation operator (*). The DataFrame is then updated using the `hcat` function, which horizontally concatenates additional columns to the existing DataFrame.
